title: Beyond the breadline: Charitable food provision and survival strategies of the urban poor in a comparative perspective
descriptions:
**Abstract:**

This grant proposal addresses a critical gap in the study of Charitable Food Provision (CFP) amidst growing concerns of food insecurity in urban populations. While food charities have become increasingly vital following the Great Recession, particularly in light of sustainable food surplus use and reduced welfare benefits, there is a lack of comprehensive frameworks for understanding and comparing CFP across different international contexts. The proposed research seeks to fill this void by offering a comparative analysis of CFP trajectories and dynamics within diverse welfare and civil society regimes and examining the impact of sustainable agri-food transitions on CFP.

The project has three primary objectives: first, to trace the historical development of CFP in Italy, Japan, and the Netherlands through event sequence analysis, highlighting the evolution of professionalized CFP sectors amidst varying institutional settings. Second, it aims to utilize mixed-methods social network analysis to explore current CFP dynamics in the cities of Palermo, Kyoto, and Rotterdam. This will involve an in-depth examination of the relationships among CFP providers, their operational strategies, and their interactions with state and non-state actors. Third, the proposal intends to conduct urban ethnography to delve into the reliance on CFP as part of the survival strategies of the urban poor.

An innovative element of this research is the development of a tool for city workshops to enable real-time data collection on CFP urban dynamics. The integration of these methodologies will result in a comprehensive framework that can be applied to further extend CFP comparisons to other global contexts. This research promises to contribute significantly to the fields of urban studies, sustainability, organizational behavior, food systems, and social policy by providing novel insights into the interplay between food support systems and food insecurity.
